SEARCH

Class BinaryLinearSearch

java.lang.Object
BinaryLinearSearch
public class BinaryLinearSearch extends Object
Contains all methods required to create a character array and search through it using multiple methods. Student Name: Fadi Rizk Student Number: 041174349 Course: CST8130 302 - Data Structures CET-CS-Level 3 Professor James Mwangi PhD. Declaration: I declare that this is my own original work and is free from Plagiarism

    generateRandomChars()
    Creates and fills an array randomly based on CHARACTERS string

    iterativeBinarySearch(char[] array, char key)
    Performs an iterative binary search for a provided char, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds

    Performs an iterative linear search of a provided character, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds

    Performs a recursive linear search for a provided character value, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds.

    Prints a copy of the array based on the current search range, is called in all other search methods.

  • Method Details

    • iterativeBinarySearch

      public int iterativeBinarySearch(char[] array, char key)
      Performs an iterative binary search for a provided char, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds
      Parameters:
      array - The sorted array of characters to search in.
      key - The character to search for within the array.
      Returns:
      the array position, or -1 if the value is not found

    • recursiveBinarySearch

      public int recursiveBinarySearch(char[] array, char key, int left, int right)
      Performs a Recursive Binary Search for provided char, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds
      Parameters:
      array - array of characters
      key -
      left -
      right -
      Returns:
      the array position, or -1 if the value is not found

    • generateRandomChars

      public char[] generateRandomChars()
      Creates and fills an array randomly based on CHARACTERS string
      Returns:
      the array position, or -1 if the value is not found

    • remainingElements

      public void remainingElements(char[] arr, int left, int right)
      Prints a copy of the array based on the current search range, is called in all other search methods.
      Parameters:
      arr - array of chars
      left - leftmost point of search range
      right - rightmost point of search range

    • iterativeLinearSearch

      public int iterativeLinearSearch(char[] array, char key)
      Performs an iterative linear search of a provided character, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds
      Parameters:
      array - char array
      key - search value
      Returns:
      the array position, or -1 if the value is not found

    • recursiveLinearSearch

      public int recursiveLinearSearch(char[] array, char key, int index)
      Performs a recursive linear search for a provided character value, also printing the duration of search in nanoseconds and milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      array - The array of characters to search in.
      key - The character to search for within the array.
      index - The current index being checked during the recursive search.
      Returns:
      The index of the character in the array if found, or -1 if the character is not present in the array.
